result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon L. Boettcher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brandon L. Boettcher is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brandon L. Boettcher was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:50 P.M. Defendant Brandon L. Boettcher in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15CM385, 16CM375 and 16cm364. Schiek states agreement/Richard in agreement. State moves to dismiss Count 2 in 16cm375 - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Battery/Domestic Abuse enhancer. State's motion in 15cm385 to rescind - Granted. Court finds defendant guilty of Battery. State moves to dismiss 16cm364 - Granted. Court questions DA's office on Victim rights legislation - Court is satisfied that victim rights legislation has been complied. Schiek/Richards/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence

WHS/POP - 12 months
